top_comment.text:
es un nerd en el colegio lo cagamos a palos por gil, aparte todo lo que 
dice lo estudio, ni siquiera habla por si mismo, pedazo de pelotudo!﻿
top_comment.author: marton aller

comments.text:
En el colegio lo cagas a palos por gil? Esperá un par de años pedazo de 
pelotudo, y te van a caber un par de cosas mas que unos roscazos en la 
boca. Espero que cambies, por tu bien.
comments.author: psyrslpsplitjface

comments.text: Algun dia vas a trabajar para el y te va a caber
comments.author: leviix360

comments.text:
quiza sea como decis, pero no habla bien de vos que "caguen a palos" a los 
diferentes a los que no piensan como vos, sos un intolerante y comos vos 
hay demasiados y no producen amor. Si Santiago tiene el valor de exponerse 
para ayudar tiene el valor del que vos carecés. Comete tu envidia y sali a 
hacer algo mas grande y recien habla

que capo que sos vos!! quedate dónde estás bobo... deja que los 
inteligentes hablen, y vos quedate callado.
comments.author: Mauro Bilotti

captions.text: Imagine that all of a sudden

you recognize nothing 
and no one around you.
You can’t find the people you want.
You can't communicate
or you ask for help but no one responds.
Imagine you are lost.
Luckily, this didn’t happen to me
nor to my family,
but it happened to lots of people.

In Argentina, a person
goes missing everyday.

This means that more than 1,000 people
have disappeared over the last 3 years.
When I heard this,

I strongly felt that something 
should be done,

that a topic this important
cannot be left aside.

I began investigating and I found little
to begin with on this topic.
On the other hand, during this summer

I was very interested in
all the aspects of programming.

I’ve been enthusiastic
about it since I was a child.
But this summer I decided to take courses

and insisted that my teachers
help me code.

This is how I entered
a new and exciting world.

I noticed that you could do
great things with programming,
but few of them had solidarity purposes.

After all this, I came up 
with a great idea:

merge what I had learned
about programming
with the problem of missing persons.

I created a digital platform
to help find them.

What I value the most is the moment
when I began with all of this.

I didn’t know where to begin,
but I started anyway.

At first, it seemed impossible
to do something like this.
It seemed unachievable.

Fortunately, I decided 
to develop this project.

During development,
I realized it can be done,

that with effort and perseverance
you can achieve what you imagine.

Little by little, all the barriers 
on my way to implementing this idea
were breaking down.

The idea is that a family member
can report a missing person,

and the users nearby
the place of disappearance

receive a notification
when this happens,

so that they can help find that person
by giving you valuable data,

such as where the person was last seen
and what was wearing.

By building the network of users,
we could fulfill our objectives together:
to find missing people as soon as possible

and reduce the great distress
their families are in.
The idea is to collect and unite

all the information about a person,
that remains sparce most of the times,

so that the organizations and people
looking for that person

instantly receive the latest 
updated information.
Two months ago I had a great opportunity

to join a NGO in Argentina
called "Missing Persons."

They had a page which only showed
a list of missing persons

and I’m glad that soon
they will be using my platform
to improve the search.
(Applause)

In fact, users can already
report missing people
on the official webpage of the NGO,
and we’re currently working on
the missing persons' profiles,
as well as on developing a mobile app.

When I started this, I knew very little
about how such a platform worked.

The whole process of developing it
helped me learn a lot.

Besides, when you do what you like,
learning is almost a side effect.
Anyway, you learn a lot.

The best way to learn something
is to practice it 100%.

With all this, I reached
an unimaginable point in my life,

I achieved what seemed impossible
to many people, myself included.

During this process I experienced 
both ups and downs,
moments when I felt like giving all up,

and others that gave me strength 
to reach the end,

which, at first, 
seemed far and impossible.

This is how I fulfilled 
my two big dreams and passions:
to develop a project from start to finish,

and my favorite,
to help find missing people.
(Applause)
Imagine that, all of a sudden,

you recognize nothing 
and no one around you.

You can’t find the people you want, 
you can't communicate
and if you ask for help, no one responds.
Imagine you are lost.

Now imagine that there is a community
aware of those who are missing,
with more tools to find them
and searching for them at the moment.
Thank you.
(Applause)

title: Imagínense que están perdidos | Santiago Aranguri | TEDxORTArg
